website_summaries.verdict: This is a practical portable gas tank that works great for boaters.
pros: Holds an ample amount of fuel and provides a steady, controlled stream when pumping gas
We love that it comes with a 1-year warranty
cons: Would be a much-improved product if it drained completely

customer_reviews.title: Need quality control and inspecting.
customer_reviews.text: I hate to give it one star. Unfortunately it appears there is no quality control nor inspection before they ship these things out. The whole lower section is cracked near the area of the Axel. It leaks faster than you can fill it. I see others have had the same problem with these things. Great idea but poorly built. Wow, what mess, leaked diesel fuel all over in the bed of my truck!
customer_reviews.author: B & C

customer_reviews.title: ... was apprehensive about buying this product because of its bad reviews and it was so much less expensive than ...
customer_reviews.text: I was apprehensive about buying this product because of its bad reviews and it was so much less expensive than the other items out there. But after doing my research I found that even the ones that are $500+ had just as many bad reviews and flaws. I almost didn't even bother getting a product like this. But after trying to use a gas can to fill my boat and fighting the waves in the water I decided might as well try it out. After receiving it I must say I LOVE this product. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelynn L.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware: Low quality, no way to reach out to company, frustrating buy
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive this item, but after just a few uses - and after the short window to return - a critical piece broke. I would've been able to deal with how slow it empties and how you can only use it to fill up things below/downhill from the gas tank, but the broken piece and no way to reach out to the company leave me with regret. I hope someone from the company helps me because of this review...
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Review

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews we thought we’d try this because who isn’t sick of spilling gas every time you fill a lawn mower or snow blower... well this also spills!!!! First... the huge tank has to be higher than whatever you are filling because it uses gravity to empty the tank... second... the safety mechanism that holds the hose broke as soon as we tried it so fingers crossed the hose doesn’t pop off...third... gas drains very slowly and the handle isn’t easy to hold down for 20 min to get a gallon in and after the dang thing leaks all over. Save your money and buy a regular gas can.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Leaked badly - not from discharge or inlet, unusable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one container. No apparent packaging damage and arrived on time. Filled approx. 1/2 full to test out how it all worked. Container leaked badly somewhere along the wheel axle, in both the vertical and horizontal position. Drained the container as much as possible - not all liquid is easily drained. Resolved with Amazon to get a full credit without returning item as I will be cutting it in two and cleaning before disposal. It can not be used. Did not want a replacement. I will look for a better quality container.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B

customer_reviews.title: Good concept but cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this several years ago and have had to replace the plastic handle/hose twice and when filling the boat today, more gas was leaking from the handle than going into the boat. A replacement handle is $50 so essentially I’ve paid for the gas caddy twice and I WILL NOT be spending another dime on this CHEAPLY MADE product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't even bother trying
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could rate this as a zero. The thing is Incredibly difficult to maneuver when full, the hose doesn't have a good place to be stored without falling to the ground. It constantly leaks after use from the dumbest handle ever made. Within a few weeks the cheap plastic clamps they use for the hose broke. Also, you can never get all the gas out of it. I would return this in a heart beat if I could but sadly we waited too long before using it and missing the return window. If you want to throw away $100 then you would be better off just taking a match to it. Horrible waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan Beihl

customer_reviews.title: Didn't describe how the gas would come out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't describe how the gas would come out of the tank. I assumed it had a motor and pumped it out. I need it for my cars and I have to lift it up higher than the car in order for gravety to drain the gas. Also, there is now way to compeltly drain it. At least half a gallon is left each time because the hole where it comes out is higher than the bottom o f the tank. Doesn't matter how much you tip it, it won't completely drain.
customer_reviews.author: visa

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The gas tank only works if the tank your filling up is underneath this fuel tank. Makes it very difficult and awkward to use. Also the handle does not generate very much pressure as advertised. I tried to return it but can’t because fuel has been through the lines. I emailed the company but no response.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Runs very slow
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be good for filling up the boat but it runs so slow that I can take the boat out of the water and drive it to the gas station and come back with a full tank before this will empty the 14 gallons. That may be a stretch but it's not far off. Very disappointed in the product. It leaks around the bottom switches.
customer_reviews.author: CStroup

customer_reviews.title: REAL SLOW drain into my boat tank. I don't ...
customer_reviews.text: REAL SLOW drain into my boat tank. I don't use it anymore. Also you cannot get all of the gas out if this tank
customer_reviews.author: Steve zz

customer_reviews.title: one of the better purchases we've made for our boat
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for 2 boating seasons now and it has definitely paid for itself in gas savings v. buying from the state dock. Note that there are two valves that you must turn on prior to dispensing. We also use a piece of wood to keep the handle in the open position because it dispenses slowly and hurts your hand if you try to pump all 14 gallons in by hand. What is preventing me from giving it 5 stars is that the wheels are inadequate for the weight. The shaft has already bent. Future designs could certainly improve on this. All in all, one of the better purchases we've made for our boat.
customer_reviews.author: L. Recker

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought it so I would have some gas in the garage or to take with me on a weekend trip to fill the generator. Works great as long as you have it above what your filling. Such as the tailgate of the pickup. Works good for generators, trimmer, push mower, small riding mower or atv. Having a nozzle is nice. One down side is that it can swell up and the wheels will not roll. Maybe a guy could fix that problem but it hasn’t bothered me much. Over all a good little tank
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Fiegen

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made! Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Needed large fuel capacity for boat, jet ski and other equipment. Bought this thinking that it would be easy to use with their pump.. but the pump doesn't work well at any point, the plastic line kinks badly where it connects to the gas can and then to add insult to injury, the seals broke on both ends of the line and gas just leaks out by the pump handle and the connection to the tank. It's relegated to just a holding tank now that stores fuel for me and I need to pump it out using other means.
customer_reviews.author: CDM

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few years now and got so tired of all the problems I just use it for fuel storage now. Got tired of lifting up 80+ pound full tank onto some makeshift platform so the tank could gravity drain, otherwise your hand will go numb trying to pump fuel. Note: The hose kinks at the base of dispenser handle, causing issues with flow. Also the hose holder is so flimsy it bends and the hose falls off. What a disappointment. I wanted to like this but just cant recommend to anyone. Buy something better quality...
customer_reviews.author: Parothed11

customer_reviews.title: The concept here is great but the execution is poor and potentially dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this for the track. I bought this to bring to the race track with me so I can fuel up with my own gas. It is gravity fed so you have to place it higher then your cars tank to get it to fill. I placed it on the bed of my pickup and it worked ok. That part was all ok but was not was the extremely leaky handle and hose. That part is completely unacceptable. The concept here is great but the execution is poor and potentially dangerous!
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Lots of issues
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of the gas cans. One came missing the cap (where the pressure release valve is located). Pep Boys wants me to send the entire thing back as opposed to just sending me a cap. Currently running generator due to Hurricane Florence and last thing I need to do is find a box, ship, wait and finally get them to send a full new system. Regarding use ... 14 gallons weighs a lot. Having to get this to a height greater than a generator is not fun. No chance the wife can refill and put high enough on her own.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Pump handle is JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Expect the handle to start leaking (ie pouring gas all over your hands and yard everytime you squeeze it) after 6 months with no way of fixing it. This is the 3rd one and never again, it's is a total POS!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Leaking!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately a leak developed near the axle and this is no longer function. We have used it only a few times and now it was a completely waste of money. I would not recommend this for anyone to purchase. You are much better off just buying the cheap smaller gas containers from walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Angelea Sparks

customer_reviews.title: 2 major flaws for my use - Hard rubber wheels which don't turn easily and fuel hose that crimps
customer_reviews.text: I have had this since 2013 and I have made it work so I gave it 2 stars. However, it is a pain. For my usage it needs pneumatic wheels, these hard wheels just don't turn easily and if you don't regularly clean and use lithium grease they won't move at all. The fuel hose crimps way too easily and makes it very difficult to use once you have one or more crimps. With better wheels and a better non crimp fuel hose it would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: billq

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Engineering and Materials
customer_reviews.text: I, like others who have left reviews on this product, am disappointed in the quality. The plastic wheels do not spin freely when the tank is loaded down with fuel. So when you move the tank around you are dragging, or skidding, the wheels across the floor. The hose connection at the bottom of the tank has a compression ring around the barbed valve connector. Shortly after I received the tank and filled it with gas I noticed the ring was brittle, had expanded and broke and when I touched it, it fell to the floor. Now that valve connection is leaking gas onto my floor. Very sad!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Busch

customer_reviews.title: Leaks and pump lasted about two months
customer_reviews.text: First off, the hose leaked. I put a hose clamp on it and got it to stop leaking. Second, the pump only lasted about two months. The only way to get it to work is to use gravity feed. Save your money and buy quality.
customer_reviews.author: armyminusr

customer_reviews.title: You have to have it higher that what you are filling
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fuel up my tractor. I thought that I would not have to lift heavy fuel cans anymore as I would be able to pump the fuel in. No, you have to have the container above what you are filling. There is no way that I can lift the container five feet off the ground, so that I can fuel the tractor. So for me, this was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have seen a lot of reviews complaining about the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have seen a lot of reviews complaining about the hose or the siphon handle. It will siphon even if it is sitting lower than what you are siphoning into, but it goes very slow. If you get it above, it will drain it quickly. Hose does not kink, ample cut off's, wheels are find for pavement, but I end up dragging it across my yard to my boat house. Be sure to open the vent valve and the two cut off's. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Drip.... drip...drip.
customer_reviews.text: 0 stars. Gas dripped out. Absolutely no pump feature. We purchased to fill up jet ski in water and using this would have taken hours. I’d rather heft up the can myself.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hyser

customer_reviews.title: parts not available to repair.
customer_reviews.text: After one year of very light use the pump handle leaks bad. Took it apart to see what was wrong. The rubber hose piece had deteriorated and now has a large gap in it and a small crack on other end. It's a reducer type part and I can't seem to locate where to buy another. You can purchase a hose/pump assembly for half the cost of a new complete assembly. But the part needed should cost less than a few dollars. What a rip off. It should last longer than a year. I've had gas cans last several years. Not this one. Don't buy unless you have money to burn.
customer_reviews.author: Baddog

customer_reviews.title: I regret buying this
customer_reviews.text: The pump worked the first couple of uses. But it became more and more difficult to use. Had to keep raising the height at which is it sat. I built a stand and still had to hold it up to get it to flow. The design makes it to where it has around a gallon of gas that cannot make it to the outlet valve. Wanted to return but they have a restocking fee and I would have to pay the shipping. Now its just sitting in the box because its not even worth the hassle of using it. I regret buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Other than that is not a great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't empty. I feel the design is flawed. I bought it in desperation of a hurricane and it helped. Other than that is not a great buy.....I think The gas should go to the absolute bottom of the barrel.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for getting ethanol free gas for my lawn equipment
customer_reviews.text: Great solution for getting ethanol free gas for my lawn equipment. Placing it on top of a wire rack allows gravity feed for the fuel. I will be adding a ratchet strap to secure them to the wall to prevent any chance of them falling over.
customer_reviews.author: Absurd

customer_reviews.title: Pump is absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.text: The can is cool, but the gas pump arrived with the spout broken off. I ended up returning it and getting three 16-gallon cans & a siphon pump for less than the rolling can.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfpack Six

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous design flaw!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible design flaw! I bought two of these, and both nozzles came off when using them! The hose is attached with a plastic band, and it broke off on both of them! Fuel spilled everywhere! Very dangerous! I'm going to try use a hose clamp to fix them! See attached!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Fogus

customer_reviews.title: More difficult to use than meets the eye
customer_reviews.text: Lowered the boat off the lift, ok, tied it close to the dock, still ok, but never could empty all the gas out.. The portable tank has to be much higher than the boat gas tank to work but still always gas left in portable tank and the line kinks at the on/off nozzle. I see the line will need to be replaced sooner than not. Spent more money to buy a portable pump and it works ok with still plenty of work in the process. I should have put more thought into what I was buying. Would not purchase again, way too much work to have gas at my private dock.
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of junk. Initially I was happy with how much gas it took, but it proved to be no more useful than those cheap gas cans with the painful release nozzle at the tip. It fills super slowly and must be elevated to empty completely. When full of gas the wheels don't turn as they should. I recommend trying it soon after purchase so you don't end up getting stuck with it like I did. I'm past the one month return window unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Faheem Guirgis

customer_reviews.title: 100% gravity fed
customer_reviews.text: By definition, the word siphon means a tube used to convey liquid upwards from a reservoir and then down to a lower level of its own accord. There's nothing about this unit that conveys liquid "upwards" whatsoever. It's 100% gravity fed. I had to fabricate a 4 foot stand just to fill my motorcycles. This unit is overpriced for what it is. Had it come with an actual battery operated siphon action, it'd be worth the asking price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea, Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: Great Idea, Not so Great Design. The way to is built, there is about a 1/2 gallon of gas that really can't come out of the tank, by hose or by any other means without making a complete mess... I bought it for filling up out pontoon boat at the dock, instead of carrying 2 - 3 cans out, just wheel this out, it works okay, but like I said the last 1/2 gallon or so sits below the hose connection sooo... Anyway, I still use this, but now I use it in my garage for filling up the Lawn tractor, and other machines...
customer_reviews.author: BMarshall

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to garage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I purchased a generator from Northern Tool. Just for refueling that. But since then I've bought a pressure washer and now this fuel tank takes care of all my refueling needs. There was no way I was gonna load up my generator in my truck to go refuel it and the new smaller gas can suck. This refueling station has been a life saver. I have it setup on a small shelf and use it to refuel all my equipment now.
customer_reviews.author: Weldamater12

customer_reviews.title: Great Gravity Gas Refill for Marine Applications
customer_reviews.text: I use this gas container to refuel my boat to avoid paying marina prices. It works on gravity flow, so the bottom of the can needs to be at or above the filler height on your boat. Fuel flow rate delivers contents of the can in about 13 minutes. It states the capacity at 14 gallons, but mine delivers just above 15 gallons. Very heavy when full, so a bit cumbersome to put in and take out of vehicle. Invaluable tool for me.
customer_reviews.author: Biggs

customer_reviews.title: Money Saver
customer_reviews.text: I use this for fill up my boat. Marine gas can cost 1-2 dollars more and a trip the marina can take an extra hour. The wheels could be improved and its tough to get that last quarter gallon out. Its a little bit more of a physical effort using this item but I am a 260lb male so i need the exercise. Smaller people could find it tough lifting this full out of a car. Over all I like it and it has saved me a ton of cash.
customer_reviews.author: R. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Huge Fan of these!  Best thing since sliced bread!
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan! I bought two of these and they work great!!! Obviously can get a little heavy but not as bad as you think. Why didn’t I think of this design years ago??? We have been hauling gas down to the dock to fill up the boats for years. This is the best thing since sliced bread! Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: TheJohnHurlow

customer_reviews.title: Solid tank, hose is junk
customer_reviews.text: I really like the quality of the tank. But the hose and clamps are pure trash! The cheap plastic ring clamp broke in the first week, the hose wall is so thin it is constantly pinching it's self closed so the fuel moves really slow it if will even flow at all. I have been fighting it all summer to find a solution that will make it work as advertised. I am going to have to replace the hose with a actual automotive grade thick wall hose so it stops kinking and add actual hose clamps to prevent leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Can’t Empty Gas Container
customer_reviews.text: The flow is very slow (I use a shaker siphon instead of the gas-pump like nozzle). The worst design fail is that about 1/2 gallon of gas remains in the bottom of the gas container, below the drain outlet, and it’s nearly impossible to completely drain the container. I contacted the manufacturer and they admit to this design flaw and said they do NOT plan to redesign the container. Doesn’t seem like a safe or practical design.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Fuel storage
customer_reviews.text: I give it a 3 because of the storage capability. Once you start to pump the gas out the handle it has a locking mechanism which is good for storage. However trying to pump the gas for me the handle locked up so easy during a power outage and it’s raining it’s so inconvenient. I even tried using the remaining gas in the vehicle when it wasn’t raining and same the locking mechanism just made it hard for me. It’s a constant hand pump and if you stop for a fraction it locks back up that fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient garage fuel storage
customer_reviews.text: Convenient for the garage for refueling motorcycle or lawn mower or similar. Holds 14 gallons and has a gas station style dispensing nozzle. I mounted mine about 4 feet high on a secure platform against the wall to allow gravity feed of the gas. The only complaint I have, and why I gave 4 stars instead of 5, is that it nearly immossible to tell how much fuel is in the container. For the price you'd expect it to have one of those semi clear sight lines running vertically so you could tell how full it is, but sadly, no such thing.
customer_reviews.author: R. Donnell

customer_reviews.title: I just wasted $130 and have no clue how to get it ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my hubby for Father's Day. We have used this four times and already the plastic cap that held in the handle broke off and as of today, the wheels have stopped working. I just wasted $130 and have no clue how to get it fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Katepalli

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I like having to go to the gas station less and not lifting 5 gallon gas jugs all day. I mounted this upright on a solid wood platform and secured it to the wall of my enclosed trailer. The handle is a pump just to be clear so you do have to keep squeezing it to deliver gas. Also I filed off that safety catch on the handle so I could operate it with one hand, much better.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: ... cut that part out and replaced - not any better - can elevated
customer_reviews.text: Fuel just barely comes out -thought there was a kink so we cut that part out and replaced - not any better - can elevated , valves open, vent open - don’t want to spend that much time in the sun filling our boat - when I could have driven 20 minutes to the marina -paid extra and enjoyed the water sooner - disappointed in rate of flow
customer_reviews.author: undur

customer_reviews.title: My updated review after 1 year...DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I previously gave this thing 4 stars, but now after nearly a year of use I decided to update my review. I have used it about 10 times. This thing is complete junk. Fuel Nozzle...leaks then completely broke. It cannot be repaired. Fuel line...kinks, won't stay rolled up, and is the cheapest hose I have ever seen. Valves...both occassionally leaked. Fuel line holder...flimsy and doesn't really hold the coiled the fuel line. Wheels...might was have been sleds. Don't roll well and cheaply constructed. The only good thing I have to say about this product is that the tank did not leak. I wish I would have saved my $115 bucks. I will never again buy a plastic rolling gas can.
customer_reviews.author: RobbyB

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane Ready
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this gas tank for our generator. We live in a hurricane zone so we want to be prepared. Having a large tank like this prevents multiple trips to the gas station. The wheels are a huge plus and the gas flows with ease. Keep it upright when full. I highly recommend to include this in your hurricane preparation plan!
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Grammo

customer_reviews.title: This things is amazing. Not only is it the equivalent of 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: Living in a rural area can have its set backs. It can be a real nuisance constantly lifting gas cans to refill whatever needs it and then in town refilling the gas cans. This things is amazing. Not only is it the equivalent of 3 + gas cans, but it can be laid on its back and filled while in the bed of the truck. I love that it has wheels on it, and I can refill whatever may need refilling without having to lift a thing or worry about spilling gas on myself. For me this Transfer Pump has been a real game changer and I couldn't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two trips and the 35 tank is good to go for the season
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this simply to transfer gasoline from the station to a 35 gallon cart I have in my garage (because nobody likes messing with 5 gallon cans in 0 degree weather when it's time to plow the driveway off). Two trips and the 35 tank is good to go for the season. The 35 gallon tank I use has a bi-directional pump so I can not comment on how the pump on this unit works as I've never used it. Seems to be solid and has not leaked on me yet. I would recommend no more than 13 gallons in this unit as it gets a little dicey with the pressure in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: NotaHappyCamper

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: I should have taken the advise of those who gave 2 n 1 star. Just not good
customer_reviews.author: RITZ

customer_reviews.title: Nice tank short hose
customer_reviews.text: Gas tank is easy to maneuver even with 14 gallons of gas in it. I was a little disappointed with the length of the hose it says 10 feet but that is a little suspect those should be about 12 feet for Optimum performance in my opinion other than that I am completely satisfied with the pump tank.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, slow to fill, but can get the job done
customer_reviews.text: leaked fuel during transport, maneuvering to our boat was fine, hose clamps are cheap and the clamp at the bottom broke immediately causing me to manually hold the hose on the valve until I get new clamps. Flow rate is terrible. I tried everything; pumping the handle a ton, opening the valve at the top to increase flow, etc. Seemed like it took about 30 min to empty ....and like many reviews have said, it leaves about a gallon of gas even if you tilt it. Overall, not happy and would have rather bought 3- 5 gallon gas cans.
customer_reviews.author: Mctcincy

customer_reviews.title: While I appreciate the size and configuration of the tank ...
customer_reviews.text: While I appreciate the size and configuration of the tank, the finish of some parts leaves a lot to be desired. The wheels locked up when I tried rolling the tank on my dock. I loosened the nuts on the axle and it seemed to help a bit. The fuel hose is fair but the nozzle is really cheap. For the price it is what I expected, though.
customer_reviews.author: David Rowland

customer_reviews.title: no leaks, rolls easy, siphon pump works.
customer_reviews.text: mine works great so far. holding and dispensing fuel for a week, with probably 1/4 mile so far of rolling it around on grass and dirt on my property defueling then refueling my gas powered equipment - I did not winterize my equipment last fall, so had to get the old "oxygenated" fuel out and fresh fuel added.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy P.

customer_reviews.title: please tell me what there is to like about this product
customer_reviews.text: The wheels stick, the house connections leak, and the gas takes forever with the hand pump...please tell me what there is to like about this product. I will probably give this product away on craigslist.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered because going to an from gas station was getting to be too much of a hassel, what with all the traffic and getting worse every day! The gas caddy works fine and was delivered in a timely manner! A very good product. Price could be better, we will see how long it lasts. I plan to take very good care of it. Dan Wright Feb. 9th, 2019
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: The Nozzle design is not robust after repeated use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased in June 2019 and have used this over the course of a year (probably refilled 3-4 times). The handle used to transfer fuel from the plastic container to equipment has essentially fallen apart (gas leaks from seams) and renders the entire assembly completely unusable. As a gravity feed this works fine but if you are required to fill by pumping the nozzle in your application the handle won't stand up from my experience.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I would of gave this product 5 stars, but It doesn't hold 14 gallons. Perhaps a flawed unit. Ive filled it up 4 times, as of now, max capacity is 13 gallons. Again, it could be just my tank. Yet, I am extremely happy with how it functions, with no leaks, and flows fast with one priming pump. Im happy - 13 gallons is good enough!
customer_reviews.author: The Truth

customer_reviews.title: Read instructions works great
customer_reviews.text: So I didn’t read the instructions and almost blew my eye out lol. When you go to fill it after the initial fill there is apparently a little valve in the middle of the gas cap that relieves pressure... please use it... I did not and the gas cap when almost taken off blew off from the pressure that had built up by the fumes. So do that and you will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Not all it's made out to be
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to roll on the dock and fill my boat. There's a good flow of fuel up until it is half full then flow drops to a trickle. The shutoff valve on the tank faces downward and is hard to turn. The tank will not fully drain, the drain needs to be at the bottom of the tank. The wheels don't turn freely.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Drinkard

customer_reviews.title: Product is good quality, I think it would work great for ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is good quality, I think it would work great for a boat. I purchased it to fill lawn mowers and ATV's. I prefer to use 2.5 gal No-Spill gas cans. This product is every thing it claims to be, the handle is a little flimsy and it need to be higher than the tank you are filling because it gravity feeds.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product, do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a delayed 8 mos review. First the wheels never ever worked. They are cheap and the design is so poor that you actually drag this thing. I have to put it on my tow dolly to move when full. Not what I excepted. That's not the reason I'm writing this, the reason is that after only 8 mos the handle is leaking. I've only used it a few times and gasoline now leaks from the poorly designed handle. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the money. Works well, but I wish it had better wheels.
customer_reviews.text: Great Value for the money. Works well, but the last half gallon of gas is just about impossible to get out of the tank and wish it had better wheels. I'm not sure how to improve upon the design to get the last bit of gas out, but I'm still 100% satisfied overall. Down the road, I will probably upgrade it and put better wheels on it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Boynton Beach FL

customer_reviews.title: Be aware does not pump and VM Express customer service unhelpful
customer_reviews.text: Product seems okay, but really only for boats. Two issues. You have to have it raised higher than the receiving tank and able to lift 14gals/84+lbs, from truck bed or above receiving tank. VM Express customer service was unhelpful in trying to return. Did not realize it was sold by non-Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.  Must Have
customer_reviews.text: This is the unit to buy. You know you will look at other gas tanks, but I am glad I researched and found this one. I'll save you the time. You will not be disappointed. I fill mine almost full in the back of my SUV. It gets a little heavy, but manageable. I have to get this down 27 steps to our lake, and I am glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gravity Fed
customer_reviews.text: This works great if the machine you are fueling is below you. It works off a gravity feed and does not have a hand pump. Unfortunately, I missed this very important description so this thing is worthless for me. I bought it to fill up my boat and snowmobiles which are above my filling height.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wear gloves, as hose can leak.
customer_reviews.text: While I use this weekly at the dick with my boat, the base of the hose leaked from day one luckily, by closing the valves between uses, you can empty the hose back into the receptacle to minimize the amount spilled, but still a hassle. Otherwise, this is so much easier to fuel up the boat at my dock with the much more reasonable prices of fuel from inland gas stations as compared to those on the water.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Mainz

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Love this tank I have had to pump the fuel with the handle and gravity feed the key to the best flow is adjusting the air vent to create the correct pressure for a good flow when pumping the vent should be tightened enough to create more pressure, and opened for faster free flow on gravity feed.
customer_reviews.author: JimL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my use to dispose of dialysis effuent
customer_reviews.text: My husband is on home kidney dialysis and it’s perfect to capture the dialysis fluid and dispose of it in the shower. Just wheels straight from the bedside to our walk in shower. Only negative thing is that it doesn’t quite empty all the way. But it’s perfect for this chore!! I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Martha R.

customer_reviews.title: The pump setup works pretty well as long as you know how to get ...
customer_reviews.text: The wheels have never worked, once you fill it up the sides of the can expand a little and the wheels are so tight to the plastic they don't roll...so you either drag 120lbs across your dock/path/trail, etc or put this in a new cart you just bought. The pump setup works pretty well as long as you know how to get it flowing, but the hose is so lightweight it doesn't take much to kink it and stop the flow or reduce it to a trickle. Better hose and better wheels and they have a homerun.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Stock

customer_reviews.title: leaking after 1 month exactly for amazon return window
customer_reviews.text: would not recommend. leaking after 1 month exactly for amazon return window before that was painfully slow....wasted my money
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Nice big gas can!
customer_reviews.text: Good gas can and works real good if the can is above the tank you need to fill. Still works even if the tank you are filling is higher but you must pump the gas up with the hand pump. The only draw back to this can is there is no level indicator. Very hard to tell how much gas is in the can.
customer_reviews.author: Robert O

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This is GREAT! Easy to fill, holds 14 gallons (hard to get all 14 gallons out), no leaks out of fittings or pump handle. Makes not having to slug 3 gas cans to the gas station very convenient. Gets a little heavy full, but to be expected but be cognizant of that before you purchase. 86.5 lbs of weight in gas plus the weight of the gas can itself. Close to 100 lbs. The notch at the bottom is a good hand hold. Also its gravity fed, so make sure it's higher than the source.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: I bought this now I need a new pump nozzle. Another huge issue for me was the tires are are on sp tight that transporting this tank from garage to boat is brutal. I decided to buy a battery powered pump made for gas or water and use that to tranfer gas from this to 5 gallon cans.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy

customer_reviews.title: Flo N Go all over the floor
customer_reviews.text: Filled with fuel set upright to use. Turned ball valve and leaked everywhere. Fuel never even made it out of the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan amazon

customer_reviews.title: Hose Pinching
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit, but the hose that comes from the gas tube will not let the gas come through the hose very well because it pinches together right where it comes out of the gas can. I have to use a something to keep the hose from pinching so the gas will come through. Which makes using the gas can hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Handle doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Given as a Christmas gift, so it wasn't needed until last month. We can put gas in, but it doesn't come out. Can't find a fix, so the tank is worthless, plus it's very heavy when full of gas
customer_reviews.author: M. Espeland

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane Supply Essential
customer_reviews.text: You got a generator? You live in Florida? You like the convenience of a rolling enormous gas can? I LOVE LOVE LOVE this device, it's simple, huge and instead of filling 10 containers, I fill one. It rolls easily from the garage to back patio where the generator runs. If we don't get a storm or power outage, I have enough gas for a years worth of lawn mowing. I would purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine Evans

customer_reviews.title: DuraMax Flo n'Go 14 Gallon Rolling Gas Can
customer_reviews.text: I will use the Duramax to get fuel to the dock for my boat. The Rolling Gas Can is nice. Rolls with ease. I don't like that Gas Can has to be above the tank you are filling.
customer_reviews.author: Fletcher H. KEE

customer_reviews.title: Handles break up and leak quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and both handles fell apart after a few uses. Also they plastic clips on the hoses all broke off and leaked shortly after purchase. Tanks themselves are good. I needed large capacity tanks for fueling boats i have that stay in water. Saved me from having to pull them out everytime i wanted to fuel. Keep them in back of truck. again handles have no longevity actually piece of garbage. would have gladly paid a few more for a decent handle. Now i've got to buy handles to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: WillNNawlins

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: At first it was very good product and worked well although I agree with some of the comments about gas coming out very slow. But after a year and a half the nozzle that allows the field to come out malfunctioned did not work. Trying to replace it through Amazon where I purchased it led me to have to deal with Prep Boys who then said that they were not able to help me even though they sold it to me. I was then asked to contact the manufacturer and the number I was given was the wrong number.I’ve had nothing but a run around over this product and suggest you do not purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: William Boydston

customer_reviews.title: Not durable enough, wheels plastic rod separates causing leak - big leak.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 2 years - the plastic tube the wheel axle goes through is glued to the tank.. it separates , thus causing a large leak. The wheels are not attached to survive rolling around much. It did work well positioned on my trailer to fill side by side .
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Fenton

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient! Used to maximize "Fuel Points" from our ...
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient! Used to maximize "Fuel Points" from our Grocery shopping discount! The transfer "Siphon Action" is more of a Pump action but was able to transfer about 8 gallons fairly quickly. I expected that once the siphon action was started it woudl continue to transfer fuel without hand pumping.
customer_reviews.author: TheirMommy2

customer_reviews.title: Great capacity, easy to move, but leaks when dispensing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tank to refill my generator and 4-wheeler and it is great for glgetting and storing a bunch of gas for my fuel hungry toys, but everytime I use the tank, I end up smelling like gas because it leaks all over the place when lifting it or dispensing from it. I guess you just need to wear some "gas can gloves" when you're actually going to use this. To be clear, I have never had a problem with it leaking while storing gas, only when moving it or dispensing.
customer_reviews.author: Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing I can fill up the tractor quad and mover and only have to get has in one container no more spilling gas on things and when at work my wife don't have to keep going out to get gas in her car if you leave it in the bed of the truck to is high enough to get the gravity fed you need
customer_reviews.author: buddy h.

customer_reviews.title: Has to be raised high to work, since it is gravity feed
customer_reviews.text: 14 gallons. Too heavy to lift when filled. Would be ice to have an antistatic cable so you can fill it in the bed of your truck without the fear of igniting the unit
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Apgar

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money !!!
customer_reviews.text: Just the thing to store your Gasoline around your garage. I have a Garden Tractor, Chain Saws, and other tools needing a steady supply of Gasoline. This is so convenient to store and supply the Gas to wherever you need it. I don't know how I got a long without one before this. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As advertised and very functional.
customer_reviews.text: I will be using it fill the boat, lawn tractor, 4 wheeler and various other small engine machines. Not able to verify as to leak proof so I couldn't rate it. At this point I am assuming that it is leak proof since it appears to be reasonably sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Wojtysiak

customer_reviews.title: Great Flow! Doesn’t spill a drop!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect! A lot better than I expected. I use this for my boat on the dock. I lower the boat from the lift and put the pump in a wheelbarrow to make it higher so the flow will work without the pumping. I do a few pumps to start the flow and it works great! Much better flow than I was expecting. I haven’t spilled a drop! Much better and easier than using 5 gallon containers to lift and poor spilling all over the lake. It’s a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Rkik

customer_reviews.title: gravity feed, hose length, two things to consider...
customer_reviews.text: The hose is about 6 feet too long. The gravity feed process does not work against the physics of the device. So, if you're filling your boat, on the water, the tank needs to be above the gas tank inlet. Doing so also requires a shorter hose, as the hose is roughly 10' a 5' hose would work. The longer hose requires working with gravity as well to provide the necessary gravity pressure to propel the fuel from the tank to it's intended destination. It beats holding a 6 gallon tank horizontally, but barely.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Greiner

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I use it to refuel the onboard generator tank for toy hauler camper. Works great. It's a little slow but once you get the level below the fuel cap you can unscrew the whole fuel cap instead of the small vent screw and it's a little faster. Seems about 10-15 minutes to dispense 14 gallons of fuel.
customer_reviews.author: Toby F.

customer_reviews.title: and it works great. For a hundred bucks
customer_reviews.text: 1st Review ever! Everyone complains about this. make sure the pump hose is tight and doesn't leak, open both valves at the bottom and the circle vent above the handle, and it works great. For a hundred bucks, no there isn't an attendant that pumps it for you....but for the cost, it's a great product. If you can't fix the leak get plumbers tape and seal the threads. We us it every weekend for 5 four wheelers....just take an extra 15 at the time of assembly and you will be AOK!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: steady container but afraid the lines will break soon
customer_reviews.text: the material of the container seems to be good quality, it should last for years, but i doubt the pike line that delivering the gas would last. especially the hand gun, it seems it’s built from cheap weak plastic. i don’t know how long would it last.
customer_reviews.author: Acadac

customer_reviews.title: Beware of static electricity with plastic tanks.
customer_reviews.text: Know what you are doing when you buy this tank. Any plastic tank needs good grounding before use. Static is your enemy on plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: It’s heavy when filled and doesn’t roll very well
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be nice to have but it’s hard to move around and when I fill it it’s very heavy to remove from truck, the plastic crimps on the hose broke on both end within a few weeks and leaked all over my garage floor👎
customer_reviews.author: Gizzmoman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t trust plastic hose clamps
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to fuel my jet ski on a dock. Gravity feed, adequate length hose. The only complaint I have is they use plastic sleeve clamps at the end of the hose. One of the clamps on mine was broken and the hose disconnected. Thankful the valve was still turned off. I have replaced those with stainless steel clamps and will continue to use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hogan

customer_reviews.title: The best option I've found, but far from perfect.
customer_reviews.text: We keep our boat on a dock without a gas station so we've tried a lot of options for fuel. So far, this is the best. It holds a lot of gas and gets the gas into the boat, so the basics are fine. It does leak. The hose is not secured with a clamp so you need to adjust it frequently. The wheels only spin if the tank is full. Once you are down to 3/4 or so of fuel the wheels don't spin. The hose doesn't secure on the handle. If you just need a way to move fuel, it does the job but it's not a perfectly designed product.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Balderaz

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself
customer_reviews.text: If you have a boat, you need this. We have saved .50 to $1 a gallon by filling up somewhere off the water and taking it to the boat rather than filling up in the marina... EVERY time we fill up. Husband said the only complaint is that the pump is a little slow but still uses it every week.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This gas tank is way over priced for its functionality. For starters the hand pump will absolutely kill your hand as it takes about 80 pumps to get a gallon of gasoline out. For 14 gallons you are way better off buying 3 5 gallon containers. It will cost you far less and dispense the gasoline much faster. I purchased this about a year ago. I only use it when I run out of capacity in my 5 gallon jugs. I have a front end loader on my tractor so I can lift the tank above and gravity flow the contents out. If I had to pump the handle to get all 14 gallons out I would have carpel tunnel.
customer_reviews.author: Windows7Guy

product_meta.title: DuraMax Flo n' Go LE Fluid Transfer Pump and 14-Gallon Rolling Gas Can
product_meta.description:
Size Name:LE Fuel Transfer Pump and Rolling Gas Can Tank Caddy,Smart. Trusted. Best-In-Class. Duramax Fuel tank is made of rugged high-density polyethylene plastic construction in vibrant red. This gas tank provides 14 gallon capacity and dispenses at 2 gallons per minute with a patented Flo n' go Maxflo siphon pump. Easily portable on 6" wheels, making maneuverability a breeze over rough terrains, ideal for marine use and landscapers. 10' long fuel hose.

Caution: Tank swelling will occur. EPA regulations have eliminated the traditional venting in these tanks. New portable outboard marine fuel tanks will not vent below 5 PSI with noticeable swelling. The new EPA compliant cap will cause the portable outboard marine fuel tanks to swell. The swelling is a result of the fuel vapor building pressure, because the cap must stay sealed up to 5PSI. All tanks must remain sealed beyond 5PSI during storage and transportation. The new tanks have been tested to remain sealed and safe at these pressures even when swelling is visible.

AMAZON.COM
Whether your fuel needs include watercraft, hunting and camping, generators, backyard power equipment, or professional landscaping tools, the Duramax Flo 'n' Go fluid transfer pump and rolling gas can make refueling a snap. The Flo 'n' Go is made of a durable, high-density polyethylene material in red that safely holds gasoline, diesel, or kerosene fuels. When it comes time to refill, the pump's patented Flo 'n' Go hand pump and pump holder handle takes over, letting you transfer fluids on level surfaces with minimal priming. And thanks to the dual mechanical shutoff valves at both the tank and hose, the tank's disconnection is spill-proof, providing a safe fuel transfer for both you and the ecosystem. 

 The tank includes a sizable 14-gallon/53-liter capacity and a 10-foot-long fuel hose, as well as a bolt-on hanger for convenient hose storage. And users will love the sturdy 6-inch wheels, which makes it a breeze to maneuver the tank over rough terrain. Other features include an ergonomically designed, heavy-duty top handle with extra-deep base unit handholds for transport; a UL-approved mechanically vented fill cap; and recessed grooves that provide nuisance-free strapping locations for safer transport. The Flo 'n' Go fluid transfer pump meets all DOT and UN transportation requirements.
feature_bullets: Duramax 14 gallon fuel tank on wheels, ideal for farm and rural use as well as marine and recreational use
Ergonomically designed, heavy-duty top handle with extra deep base unit handholds for transport
Perfect for use with outboard engines
Molded-in feet keep tank off floor for increased ventilation and stability
Accepts standard 1/4 NPT marine tank fittings
Comes with MaxFlo Siphon Pump with at-the-handle pump control allows for auto-shut-off and restarts and clean, hassle-free siphon control
Wheeled for easy transportation, high density polypropelyne for dent, corrosion and rust resistance
10 foot hose with two shut-off valves , at both the thank and the hose connector make the hoes easy to disconnect for refilling and transportation
Ideal for industrial, commercial and recreational applications
Use on light commercial equipment, farms, landscape crews, dockside and cottage applications

specifications.Size: LE Fuel Transfer Pump and Rolling Gas Can Tank Caddy,
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,879 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
